content.question: The shaded region in the figure above is bounded by the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4451@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and the lines x = -7, x = 7, and y = 2. What is the area of this region?

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x
